answers.answer: Dear erikanikole85,It is hard to give you an accurate diagnosis over the Internet without meeting you in person but  I can give you some helpful pointers.You are extremely young for developing a serious heart condition. In addition, you do not describe any significant risk factors that is history of high blood pressure, high cholesterol, diabetes, smoking, family history of premature heart disease.With an absence of  any risk factors and your age, it is very unlikely that you suffer from a heart condition.chest pain or chest discomfort can arise due to multiple conditions like lung related problems or food pipe related problems or musculoskeletal issues.Reading the description of your symptoms, I suspect that the latter two are the  likely culprits in your case.Regardless, if you continue to feel unwell, I suggest that you seek medical attention from your primary care doctor.hope that helpsCCFHeartMD19

question: I'm an 18 year old female. Weigh about 160. Mom & sister have high blood pressure, but other than that no family history of heart attacks or anything.. I smoked for 3 years but recently quit in may. I have bad anxiety, i had an ekg done in december of 2012 and everything was normal. Recently ive had mild chest pains, with lots of burpring its been a week straight, as soon as I wake up in burping, I also rode my bike today for maybe 10 mins and was out of breath and my heart was pounding... so I got scared & sat down after awhile I felt normal. In the past week ive drove myself Into 3 diff anxiety attacks from worrying, i worry I am going to have a Heart attack.. can anybody help me?
title: few concerns about heart.
